Articles.Content:
NOTE: I read the forum rules, and while it states that I cannot advertise commercial ventures, I don't think that applies to livestreams. Please do correct me if I'm wrong!

Hello Everyone! It's finally fall break for me, and I don't want it to go to waste. Considering it's October and my favorite day of the year is halfway upon us--Halloween, of course!--I've decided to do a spooky/horror-related livestream on Twitch every night of the break!

Warning: Please do know that a lot of the games on here will be primarily horror games (except for a select few which are just disturbing or atmospheric), so I highly recommend that if you're below the age of 18 or have a nervous disposition, please do not come!

Stream!

Link: http://www.twitch.tv/chufftherobot

Starts at 9 pm EST on October 12-15

10/12 - Binding of Isaac followed by Legend of Grimrock

10/13 - STALKER: Clear Sky followed by Dead Space 3

10/14 - Vanish followed by Haunted Memories

10/15 - SCP: Containment Breach (ends at 12pm)

Hope to see at least some people there!

Edited October 13, 2013 by AlternNocturn
Day 2 is starting a few minutes late. Just have to set everything up.
Ooh, ill have to make sure to catch it

Stream over! Thanks to the people that came! And sorry to the guy who tried to talk to me when I couldn't see the chat. Twitter was open and I didn't see the window.

Tomorrow is when the real scary games start. We'll start with Vanish, a randomly generated horror game of hallways in a similar vein as SCP-087-B. Then we'll play either Slender: Haunt or Haunted Memories. Same game, different styles.

Edited October 14, 2013 by AlternNocturn
Day 3 is starting in 5 minutes! Today's games: Vanish and Slender: Haunt

Final day starting in just a few minutes! Twitch chat wasn't working for a few minuets but now it's back up. I'll be getting this show on the road shortly.

Join me for SCP: Containment Breach! www.twitch.tv/chufftherobot
Stream over, thanks to the people that came out, and sorry I couldn't get SCP working. But there's more stuff being planned for the days leading up to Halloween. So I guess look forward to that.
